SEARCH
Module com.example.softmethproject4
Package com.example.softmethproject4

Class Order

java.lang.Object
com.example.softmethproject4.Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
Customizable
public class Order extends Object implements Customizable
This class is an implementation of the Customizable interface and defines an Order object. An Order object will have an int serialNumber instance variable and a ArrayList of Pizzas currentOrder instance variable. This class also defines a constructor for an Order, as well as getter methods and a toString() method.
Author:
Adwait Ganguly, Kennan Guan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Order()
    This method is a Default Constructor that constructs a new Order object with a new serial number and an ArrayList of Pizzas.

    Method
    Description
    boolean
    add(Object obj)
    This method is overriding the add method of the Customizable interface, and it allows the user to add a pizza to an Order object.
    void
    clearOrder()
    This method is used to clear the current order and decrement the orderCounter variable so the serial numbers remain consistent when creating new orders.
    ArrayList<Pizza>

    This is a getter method for an Order object's ArrayList of pizzas.

    String

    This method creates a textual representation of an order.
    void
    updateOrderCount()
    This method updates the orderCounter variable that defines the serial number of a new order.
